title: No Thanks, Dear AI! Understanding the Effects of Disclosure and Deployment of Artificial Intelligence in Public Sector Recruitment
analysis_techniques: Linear regression; Exploratory analysis; ANOVA; Simulation/experiment
research_description: This study analyzes the disclosure effects and explores the deployment of an AI application in public sector recruitment through a preregistered field experiment. The results show that disclosing AI use leads to less interest among job candidates, while the AI application shows potential efficiency gains in recruitment processes.
research_results: The findings indicate that disclosing AI applications significantly decreases candidates' interest in job offers. However, the AI application demonstrates efficiency in predicting person-job fit, providing potential benefits for public sector recruitment.
future_research: Future studies could further investigate the interplay between AI disclosure, algorithm aversion, and the effectiveness of AI applications in public sector contexts.
